age_1_3.title: Color Recognition
age_1_3.objective: Identify and name basic colors (red, blue, yellow, green)
activities: Color sorting games with physical objects
Matching colored objects to color cards
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Start with one color at a time. Use physical objects like blocks, balls, or crayons. Sing color songs and play 'I Spy' with colors. Praise correct identification and gently correct mistakes.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Point out colors during daily activities - 'Look at the red apple!' Practice with coloring books. Make it fun by having color-themed snacks or clothing days.

rubric.excellent: Identifies 4+ colors correctly and names them independently
rubric.good: Identifies 3 colors correctly with minimal prompting
rubric.needs_support: Identifies 1 color or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Animal Sounds
age_1_3.objective: Associate common animals with their sounds
activities: Acting out animal movements with sounds
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Play animal sounds and have children guess. Use picture cards to show animals while making sounds. Encourage children to mimic the sounds and movements.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Make animal sounds during story time. Visit a zoo or farm if possible. Use animal toys to reinforce sounds during play.

rubric.excellent: Correctly matches 6+ animals with their sounds
rubric.good: Matches 4-5 animals with sounds
rubric.needs_support: Matches 1 animal or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Basic Shapes
age_1_3.objective: Recognize and name basic shapes (circle, square, triangle)
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Start with circles as they're easiest to identify. Use shape sorters and puzzles. Point out shapes in everyday objects. Practice tracing shapes with fingers.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Point out shapes during daily activities - 'The window is square!' Use shape stickers for fun activities. Make shapes with snacks like round crackers.

rubric.excellent: Identifies and names all 3 basic shapes independently
rubric.good: Identifies 2 shapes correctly with minimal help
rubric.needs_support: Struggles to identify shapes or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Counting to 5
age_1_3.objective: Count objects up to 5 and recognize numbers 1-5
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Start with 1-3, then gradually add 4 and 5. Use fingers for counting. Count everything - steps, toys, snacks. Make it musical with counting songs.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Count steps going upstairs, toys during cleanup, or snacks at snack time. Point out numbers on clocks, houses, or books.

rubric.excellent: Counts to 5 independently and recognizes all numbers
rubric.good: Counts to 4 with minimal help
rubric.needs_support: Counts to 2 or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Family Members
age_1_3.objective: Name and identify immediate family members
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Show family photos and discuss roles. Create simple family trees. Use role-play to reinforce family relationships. Be sensitive to different family structures.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Look at family photos together. Talk about family members' roles. Create a family book with pictures. Share family stories.

rubric.excellent: Names all immediate family members and understands relationships
rubric.good: Names most family members with minimal prompting
rubric.developing: Names some family members with support
rubric.needs_support: Names few family members or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Simple Actions
age_1_3.objective: Understand and follow simple action words (run, jump, clap, sit)
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Demonstrate actions clearly. Use simple one-word commands. Practice with games like Simon Says. Praise attempts even if not perfect.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Give simple action requests during daily routines. Make it fun with action songs. Praise your child for following directions.

rubric.excellent: Follows 4+ action commands independently
rubric.good: Follows 3 action commands with minimal prompting
rubric.needs_support: Follows 1 action command or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Primary Emotions
age_1_3.objective: Identify and express basic emotions (happy, sad, angry, surprised)
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Use mirrors to practice facial expressions. Read emotion books. Validate all emotions as normal. Help children name what they're feeling.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Talk about emotions during daily situations. Use emotion words when your child is experiencing feelings. Model emotional expression.

rubric.excellent: Identifies and expresses 4 basic emotions appropriately
rubric.good: Identifies 3 emotions and expresses some appropriately
rubric.needs_support: Identifies 1 emotion or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Everyday Objects
age_1_3.objective: Identify and name common household objects
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Use real objects when possible. Discuss what each object is used for. Group similar objects together. Practice naming objects daily.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Point out objects during daily routines. Let your child help with simple tasks using these objects. Make it a game to find objects.

rubric.excellent: Names 8+ everyday objects independently
rubric.good: Names 6-7 objects with minimal prompting
rubric.needs_support: Names 3 or fewer objects or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Animal Recognition
age_1_3.objective: Identify common animals and their characteristics
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Start with familiar animals like cats, dogs, birds. Show pictures and discuss where animals live. Encourage animal sounds and movements.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Visit zoo or farm if possible. Read animal books together. Point out animals in the neighborhood. Use animal toys for play.

rubric.excellent: Identifies 8+ animals and some characteristics
rubric.good: Identifies 6-7 animals with minimal prompting
rubric.needs_support: Identifies 3 or fewer animals or needs significant help

age_1_3.title: Basic Hygiene
age_1_3.objective: Understand importance of basic hygiene practices
age_1_3.teacher_guide: Demonstrate proper hand-washing technique. Make it fun with songs. Use visual charts for routines. Practice before snack and after bathroom.
age_1_3.parent_guide: Establish consistent hygiene routines. Make it enjoyable with special soap or toothbrush. Praise good hygiene habits.

rubric.excellent: Demonstrates good hygiene practices independently
rubric.good: Follows hygiene routines with minimal reminders
rubric.developing: Participates in hygiene activities with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help with hygiene activities

age_4_6.title: Basic Addition
age_4_6.objective: Perform simple addition problems up to 10
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Start with concrete objects before abstract numbers. Use number lines for visualization. Create story problems with familiar contexts. Practice daily with different materials.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Use everyday situations for addition practice - 'You have 2 cookies, I'm giving you 1 more, how many do you have?' Use toys, snacks, or fingers for counting.

rubric.excellent: Solves addition problems up to 10 independently
rubric.good: Solves problems up to 5 with minimal help
rubric.developing: Solves problems up to 3 with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help with addition concepts

age_4_6.title: Letter Recognition
age_4_6.objective: Identify and name letters of the alphabet
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Teach a few letters at a time. Use multi-sensory approaches - visual, auditory, and kinesthetic. Connect letters to familiar words and names.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Point out letters in books, signs, and environmental print. Practice letter names and sounds. Use letter magnets or cards for fun activities.

rubric.excellent: Recognizes 20+ letters independently
rubric.good: Recognizes 15-19 letters with minimal help
rubric.needs_support: Recognizes fewer than 10 letters or needs significant help

age_4_6.title: Creative Storytelling
age_4_6.objective: Create and tell simple stories with beginning, middle, and end
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Start with familiar story structures. Use picture prompts for ideas. Encourage creativity over perfection. Record stories for listening back.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Ask 'What happened next?' during stories. Let your child make up stories during car rides. Draw pictures together to illustrate stories.

rubric.excellent: Creates complete stories with clear beginning, middle, and end
rubric.good: Creates stories with most elements present
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help creating stories

age_4_6.title: Healthy Eating
age_4_6.objective: Understand basic nutrition and food groups
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Use visual food pyramids. Discuss where food comes from. Practice sorting foods into groups. Connect to daily meals and snacks.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Involve your child in meal planning and grocery shopping. Discuss food choices. Try new healthy foods together.

rubric.excellent: Identifies food groups and makes healthy choices independently
rubric.good: Identifies most food groups with minimal help
rubric.developing: Identifies some food groups with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help understanding food groups

age_4_6.title: Patterns and Sequences
age_4_6.objective: Recognize, continue, and create simple patterns
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Start with simple AB patterns. Use concrete materials before abstract concepts. Encourage children to create their own patterns.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Point out patterns in nature, clothing, and household items. Create patterns with snacks, toys, or during walks.

rubric.excellent: Creates and continues complex patterns independently
rubric.good: Continues patterns with minimal help
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help understanding patterns

age_4_6.title: Time Awareness
age_4_6.objective: Understand basic time concepts and daily routines
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Focus on daily routines before clock time. Use visual schedules. Discuss morning, afternoon, and evening activities.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Create visual schedules at home. Talk about daily routines. Use timers for activities. Point out time on clocks.

rubric.excellent: Understands daily routines and basic time concepts
rubric.good: Follows daily routines with minimal prompting
rubric.developing: Understands some time concepts with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help with time concepts

age_4_6.title: Basic Geography
age_4_6.objective: Recognize continents, oceans, and basic map concepts
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Start with local geography then expand. Use globes and maps. Discuss different cultures and countries. Make it interactive with games.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Look at maps together. Discuss where family members live. Share cultural traditions. Use travel photos if available.

rubric.excellent: Identifies several continents and basic geography concepts
rubric.good: Identifies some continents with minimal help
rubric.developing: Shows interest in maps with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help with geography concepts

age_4_6.title: Environmental Awareness
age_4_6.objective: Understand basic environmental concepts and weather
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Observe daily weather. Discuss seasons and changes. Practice recycling. Take nature walks to observe environment.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Point out weather changes. Involve child in recycling. Take walks in nature. Discuss taking care of Earth.

rubric.excellent: Understands weather patterns and environmental care
rubric.good: Identifies weather and some environmental concepts
rubric.developing: Shows awareness of weather with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help with environmental concepts

age_4_6.title: Simple Science
age_4_6.objective: Conduct basic experiments and understand cause and effect
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Use simple, safe experiments. Encourage predictions. Document observations. Discuss what happened and why.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Try simple experiments at home. Ask 'What do you think will happen?' Explore nature together. Visit science museums.

rubric.excellent: Makes predictions and understands cause and effect
rubric.good: Participates in experiments with minimal help
rubric.developing: Shows interest in science activities with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help with science concepts

age_4_6.title: Music and Rhythm
age_4_6.objective: Explore rhythm, melody, and musical expression
age_4_6.teacher_guide: Start with simple rhythms. Use body percussion. Encourage creative expression. Connect music to emotions and stories.
age_4_6.parent_guide: Sing songs together. Dance to music. Make instruments from household items. Attend musical performances if possible.

rubric.excellent: Creates rhythms and expresses self through music
rubric.good: Participates in musical activities with minimal help
rubric.developing: Shows interest in music with support
rubric.needs_support: Needs significant help with musical concepts
